snippet: The Interior Ministry responded to growing anger over the government’s failure to prevent the bombings by firing the Ankara police chief and other officials.
abstract: Turkish Interior Ministry responds to public rancor over deadly Ankara bombings by firing security officials, including Ankara police chief; Prime Min Ahmet Davutoglu’s claims Islamic State and Kurdistan Workers’ Party were behind attacks increases criticism of Turkey’s military and intelligence, and raises suspicion government is using incident to reclaim its parliamentary majority.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The Interior Ministry responded to growing anger over the government’s failure to prevent the bombings by firing the Ankara police chief and other officials.

headline.print_headline: Turkey, Nodding to Public Outrage Over Attack in Ankara, Fires Security Officials
headline.main: Turkey Fires Security Officials After Attack in Ankara
